intro: Epilobium cordifolium, commonly known as heartleaf willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species like willowherbs and evening primroses. Epilobium cordifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
